sources.title: Articles on Smashing Magazine — For Web Designers And Developers

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Andrew Somers)
articles.description: In this article, Andrew Somers, a 35-year veteran of the Hollywood film and television industry, shares his experience about the hard-fought battles and lessons learned designing for illuminated presentations.
articles.title: The Realities And Myths Of Contrast And Color

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Vitaly Friedman)
articles.description: Meet “Understanding Privacy”, our upcoming book on what data privacy is really about beyond scary headlines. Approx. 350 pages. eBook available in October, print shipping in November.
articles.title: Meet Understanding Privacy, A New Smashing Book By Heather Burns

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Mike Herchel)
articles.description: In this article, Mike Herchel covers Drupal’s new default theme, Olivero, which is usable, accessible, robust, and beautiful and will help you improve websites’ navigation systems.
articles.title: The Accessibility And Usability Journey Of Drupal’s Primary Navigation

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Atila Fassina)
articles.description: In the second part of “Databases For Front-End Developers” series, Atila Fassina explores concepts to equip you to have your own opinions about which kinds of databases suit your specific needs.
articles.title: Databases For Front-End Developers: The Concepts Under The Hood (Part 2)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Zara Cooper)
articles.description: In this article, Zara Cooper provides a rundown of some popular data grid libraries that would be a great addition to any data-heavy application and shares recommendations on what factors to consider when choosing a suitable data grid library.
articles.title: Useful JavaScript Data Grid Libraries

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)
articles.description: Let’s welcome September with some fresh desktop wallpapers. Designed by artists and designers from across the globe, they come in versions with and without a calendar for the month. Enjoy!
articles.title: Finding The Balance (September 2022 Desktop Wallpapers Edition)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Shane Hudson)
articles.description: Ever felt overwhelmed by the number of things you need to learn? Today, we look at how [Uxcel](https://uxcel.com/) eases this transition and approaches actively learning new skills to take our careers to the next level.
articles.title: How To Improve And Measure Your Progress Learning Web Design

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Eduard Kuric)
articles.description: The problem of how to design an effective toggle button that shows the selected option clearly is a long-term open question among UI/UX designers. In this second part, Eduard Kuric explains a complex list of visual cues used by toggle buttons to communicate which of their options is active.
articles.title: What Makes A Great Toggle Button? (Case Study, Part 2)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Vitaly Friedman)
articles.description: Error messages need to be easy to spot, but they also need to be helpful. Let’s explore when error messages should live above input fields and why toast error messages are usually not a very good idea.
articles.title: Designing Better Error Messages UX

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Doug Sillars)
articles.description: If you need to deliver a large number of images and videos, a solution like [imgix](https://imgix.com/?utm_medium=banner&utm_source=smashingmag&utm_campaign=video-api-smashingmag-article-2022-08) can optimize and process both types of assets without you having to build it from the ground up or cobble together different solutions. Let’s take a closer look at how.
articles.title: Better Video Streaming With imgix

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Drew McLellan)
articles.description: In this episode of the Smashing Podcast, we ask how you can prove the value of a Design System and how you can pitch it effectively to stakeholders. Vitaly talks to Ben Callahan to find out more.
articles.title: Smashing Podcast Episode 51 With Ben Callahan: What’s The Value Of A Design System?

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Eduard Kuric)
articles.description: In this first part of a two-part article, Eduard Kuric analyzes the characteristics of effective toggle buttons that make it error-proof and prevent confusion and frustration of users.
articles.title: What Makes A Great Toggle Button? (Case Study, Part 1)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Caleb Olojo)
articles.description: Most users tend to forget their passwords, so create experiences that will always be valuable for people when they use your products. In this article, we’ll discuss how to implement a password-reset feature with Next.js dynamic routes while prioritizing the UX.
articles.title: Implementing A Reset Password Feature With Next.js Dynamic Routes

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Evyatar Alush)
articles.description: React popularized context-propagation within applications with the context API. Evyatar Alush brings a brief intro to context propagation in JavaScript and how you can build React Context yourself.
articles.title: An Introduction To Context Propagation In JavaScript

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Vitaly Friedman)
articles.description: With the “Back” button, users often get confused and frustrated. How to design a better back button UX and where to put those “Back” buttons in our interfaces.
articles.title: Designing A Better Back Button UX

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Christine Vallaure)
articles.description: Christine highlights some of Figma’s features and possibilities to help you build a design that aligns with code as much as needed and improve your team work.
articles.title: Everything Developers Must Know About Figma

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Chris Simmons)
articles.description: The power of framework-specific UI libraries, such as Skeleton, can lead to more productivity using the combined ability of Svelte and Tailwind to build modern web-based apps.
articles.title: Meet Skeleton: Svelte + Tailwind For Reactive UIs

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Atila Fassina)
articles.description: In this article, the first part of “Databases for Front-end Developers” series, Atila Fassina helps you understand the concepts behind database architecture in order to use them reliably and sheds some light on serverless databases.
articles.title: Databases For Front-End Developers: The Rise Of Serverless Databases (Part 1)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Zara Cooper)
articles.description: Identify, compare, analyze and fix your Core Web Vitals scores to boost web performance of your sites. These tools will help you to do just that.
articles.title: Core Web Vitals Tools To Boost Your Web Performance Scores

articles.title: JavaScript Geolocation API Tutorial – How to Get a User's Location in JS
